translations.translation: Developed by the people, for the people.
Hush is a private implementation of the "Zerocash" protocol forked from [Zcash].
Based on Bitcoin's code, it intends to offer a far higher standard of privacy through a sophisticated zero-knowledge proving scheme that preserves confidentiality of transaction metadata.
Hush trusted setup follows the same setup provided by the Zcash team. We do not have any keys to create coins from thin air.
Zcash held a ceremony where the individuals holding shards of the private key destroyed it.
We believe there aren't enough currencies out there where the development team listens to the community, where the development team are open for suggestions and discussions.
That's why we believe Hush will be a successful currency over a long-term view because of the communication between the community and the developers.
We will always consider your thoughts and ideas if they are beneficial for Hush as currency and as a community.
Cryptocurrencies are decentralized from governments but if the community can't be a part of any decisions, is it really decentralized?
With Hush your voice always matters, your contributions are always appreciated and we are always grateful for any kind of support.
You may contribute and be a part of the decisions.
There will be a slow and steady progress when it comes to value and development stability.
Because of a small premine and a dedicated dev team, finances will not be a problem.
You can review, comment and propose updates.
Uses a Peer to Peer network.
Send money to anyone in the world.
Add IPFS integration for large messages and sending binary files.
Counterparty on HUSH - funding, assets and smart contracts.

Axel is a 22 year old District Heating Planner from Stockholm, Sweden. He's been doing business, big and small, since he was about 10 years old. Axel joined the crypto-scene the first time back in 2010-2011.

David Mercer studied math and computer science at the University of Arizona. He's been involved with financial cryptography for 15 years and has a 20+ year career in IT. He did the first ports of Zcash to non-linux platforms. He has contributed to the zcash protocol design and codebase, and his pre-blockchain fintech experience includes consulting for NASDAQ, IslandECN, BofA and the 3 largest banks in Mexico.

Iolar is a 29 year old, front-end web developer and cryptocurrency day trader from Brazil. He has more than 15 years of experience in the area of web development and has worked in several agencies and companies including A Estrutural, Agrobovi, A Foco and Dual Studio.

Matthew is a freelance full-stack web developer and cryptocurrency enthusiast from Illinois. His passions are security and authentication, and gaming (#PCMasterRace). By day he is a Cyber Threat Analyst.
Contributions from the community help keep Hush alive. To contribute join us in our Slack, and review our Github repositories.
Donations keep the lights and servers on.
Because with a premine we have a financial rock to lay back on, we will be able to offer contributors bounties for their contributions.
Will be able to track the premine?
Yes, the address with the premined coins will be public.
How is the development progressing, how can I find out?
If you want to contribute, contact one of us and we'll discuss your idea(s) and how you can contribute.
How do we contact you and can we ask about anything?
, yes you can ask about anything Hush related!
Leave us a message by filling out the form below if you would like more information about the project, or have any questions about us.
(We will respond as soon as possible.)
